name: The Old Man and the C Quiz | Words for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: The _________ was afraid of the dog. What C word fits best into the blank?
questions.explanation:
cat.

	Cats can be domestic (or tame) like the house cat, or they can be wild like lions. Cats were once worshipped in Egypt.

questions.text: We rode the taxi _______ to school. What C word goes in the blanks?
questions.explanation:
cab.

	Cabs started as horse-drawn carriages in the early 1600s. The word cab came from the word cabriolet, which means carriage.

questions.text: When we go camping, we stay in a _____ in the woods. What C word do we want this time?
questions.explanation:
cabin.

	Cabins are often found in the woods, but can be found other places too. They look like miniature houses.

questions.text: Be careful! That plant is a prickly ______! What C word is it?
questions.explanation:
cactus.

	A cactus usually grows in the desert, but they can be found in other places too. They require very little water.

questions.text: A baby cow is called a ____. What C word do we need this time?
questions.explanation:
calf.

	A baby elephant is also called a calf. The plural of calf is calves.

questions.text: If you break your leg, you might need a _____.
questions.explanation:
cast.

	A cast is usually made out of plaster or fiberglass. Casts are very hard. Sometimes people have their friends sign their casts.

questions.text: Brush and floss your teeth so you don't have any ______.
questions.explanation:
cavities.

	A cavity is when there is a hole in your tooth. When this happens you have to go to the dentist to have it filled.

questions.text: Pictures or shapes made by stars in the sky are called _____.
questions.explanation:
constellations.

	Two famous constellations are the Big Dipper and the Little Dipper. The stars are far apart in the sky, but from Earth they look close together to form these pictures.

questions.text: A type of grain you can eat is called ____.
questions.explanation:
corn.

	Corn was introduced to American settlers by the Native Americans. Another name for corn is maize.

questions.text: Another word for "horn of plenty" is ______.
questions.explanation:
cornucopia.

	The cornucopia is shaped like a horn. It is filled with fruits and other food. It represents luxury and having more than enough.
